ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would certainly recommend this class!

Philosophies of time from Plato to Heidegger, with a running undercurrent of Proust. Absolutely take this course. It will change the way you think about everything, in subtle and not so subtle ways. Even if you've read some of the books on the course list, take this class so you can see how they can be synthesized with the rest of the syllabus. You will also really like Paul North.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I don't know how a course about the nature of time would NOT be helpful to a graduate student. It's the most basic element of our lives, and to spend a semester examining it from the point of view of over 2,000 years of intellectual history is a gift. Whatever my dissertation turns out to be, it will be heavily influenced by Paul North's class.
